statement: Tropical rainforest is found all over the Amazon Basin.
Farmers use ashes as fertilizer for their crops.
Banana potatoes beans and corn are grown using slash-and-burn agriculture.
Soil in slash-and-burn agriculture loses nutrition after a few years.
Farmers move to new locations when the soil loses its nutrition.
Old fields from slash-and-burn agriculture eventually become forests again.
Slash-and-burn agriculture helps forests regrow over time.
The Arapaima fish can grow more than three meters long.
Fish are an important source of protein for the people in the Amazon Basin.
One old fishing method used by people in the Amazon Basin involves poisonous plants.
Farmers cut down trees only in the dry season.
Once farmers move to a new location old fields remain barren forever.
Slash-and-burn agriculture permanently damages the forest.
The Galapagos Islands are located to the east of South America.
The Galapagos Islands were formed by earthquakes.
The species on the Galapagos Islands are the same as in South America.
The Galapagos Islands are not protected by any official designation.
Tourists are free to roam the Galapagos Islands without guides.
Some tourists caused no harm to the environment when visiting the Galapagos Islands.
Fish are never eaten by people in the Amazon Basin because they are sacred.
